Objective: May Day plans to blow up Silicon Valley's computer chip factories, crippling the US economy and making her boss, Max Zorin, the world's leading microchip manufacturer.
Outcome: Bond foils May Day's plan by stopping her and Max Zorin's accomplices, and preventing the destruction of the factories.

Objective: Chuck Lee is a henchman working for Max Zorin, and his objective is to help Zorin's plan to corner the world microchip market by destroying Silicon Valley.
Outcome: Bond foils Zorin's plan, and Chuck Lee is killed in the process.

Objective: Trigger an earthquake along the San Andreas fault to destroy Silicon Valley, thus wiping out his competitors in the microchip market and giving him a monopoly.
Outcome: Zorin leaves May Day to die. Enraged, she smuggles the bomb out of the blast radius, sacrificing herself.
Status: Falls from the top of the Golden Gate Bridge during a fight with Bond.

Objective: General Gogol is working to develop a new microchip for the Soviet Union, but the true goal is to use it to gain control over the world's computer systems.
Outcome: Bond foils the plan by destroying the microchip and preventing its theft, but General Gogol survives.

Objective: Pan Ho's objective is to steal a microchip from Zorin's headquarters, which contains the design for a new computer chip that will give Zorin a monopoly on the world's computer microchip market.
Outcome: Bond foils Pan Ho's plan when he discovers that Ho is working for Max Zorin, and that the microchip is actually a fake, which Bond then destroys.

Objective: Scarpine's objective is to steal a microchip that contains the plans for a new satellite-based computer system, which will give its owner control over the world's computer systems.
Outcome: Bond foils Scarpine's plan by stopping him from stealing the microchip, and Scarpine ultimately meets his demise in a fight with Bond.

Objective: Carlos Nikolic is a private banker who is secretly working for the terrorist organization known as the Quantum group, and his main goal is to fund their operations through a series of high-stakes poker games.
Outcome: Bond is able to infiltrate the poker game and gather information about Nikolic's true intentions, ultimately foiling his plan to fund the Quantum group.

Objective: Steven Obanno is a key player in a global terrorist network, financing the group's operations through a large heroin shipment.
Outcome: Bond foils the heroin shipment, killing Obanno in the process.

Objective: Recoup his clients' squandered funds by winning a poker tournament at the Casino Royale.
Outcome: Bond wins the tournament.
Status: Shot in the forehead by Mr. White.

Objective: To deliver a briefcase containing a large sum of money to a contact, Le Chiffre, in exchange for information about a terrorist plot.
Outcome: Bond intercepts the briefcase, foiling Gettler's plan, and later kills him in a fight.

Objective: Le Chiffre's private banker, Kratt, is tasked with laundering money for Le Chiffre's terrorist organization.
Outcome: Bond foils Kratt's plan by tracking down and killing him in a casino.

Objective: Mr. Fisher is involved in a human trafficking operation.
Outcome: Bond foils the operation and rescues the hostages.

Objective: Assassinate Le Chiffre and steal back the money.
Outcome: Succeeds.

Objective: Mollaka Danso's objective is to plant a bomb in a Miami hotel, which will detonate during a meeting of a group of wealthy investors, causing a global financial meltdown.
Outcome: Bond foils Mollaka's plan by killing him in a parkour chase, preventing the bomb from being planted.

Objective: Mr. Kidd and his partner, J.W. Pepper, attempt to steal a large quantity of diamonds from the Tiffany & Co. store in New York City.
Outcome: Their plan is foiled by Bond, but not before they manage to steal the diamonds, which are later recovered by Bond.

Objective: Mr. Wint and his brother Mr. Kidd are hired by Ernst Stavro Blofeld to steal a large quantity of diamonds, specifically the Star of Fortuna, and then kill anyone who gets in their way.
Outcome: Their plan is foiled by Bond, who discovers their scheme and thwarts their attempts to steal the diamonds.

Objective: Thumper is part of a plot to smuggle diamonds from an American mine, and later helps in the theft of a large diamond at an auction.
Outcome: Thumper's plan is foiled by Bond, who discovers the smuggling operation and thwarts the diamond heist.

Objective: Steal diamonds to fabricate a laser satellite which can remotely detonate nuclear stockpiles, then use said laser to extort the world's nuclear powers.
Outcome: Bond smashes Blofeld's mini-sub against the control room of his lair, disabling the satellite and causing severe damage to his lair.
Status: Survived the fiery demolition of the control room of his oil rig headquarters as he returns in the opening of For Your Eyes Only, where Bond drops him down an industrial chimney.

Objective: Mr. Kil seeks to sell North Korean missiles to the highest bidder, using a diamond mine as a front.
Outcome: Bond foils Kil's plan by destroying the diamond mine and preventing the sale of the missiles.

Objective: Vlad is a North Korean agent who seeks to steal a valuable microchip to sell to the highest bidder, while also seeking revenge against Bond for past encounters.
Outcome: Bond and Jinx prevent Vlad from selling the microchip, and he is subsequently killed by Jinx.

Objective: Zao seeks revenge against Bond for the death of his sister, while also working to sell North Korean technology to the highest bidder.
Outcome: Zao's plan is foiled when Bond discovers his true identity and prevents the sale of the technology, but Zao manages to escape.

Objective: Use the sun-enhancing satellite Icarus to cut a path through the Korean Demilitarized Zone, provoking a war between North and South Korea.
Outcome: Icarus is rendered harmless when Bond destroys the control device.
Status: Bond pulls the cord on his parachute, sucking him out off plane, electrocutes him and finally getting sucked into the plane's engine, ripping him to shreds.

Objective: Use a nuclear radio beam to topple Cape Canaveral's space program.
Outcome: Bond disables the radio beam by overloading the nuclear reactor.
Status: Slowly boils to death in the reactor's cooling pond after a struggle with Bond.

Objective: Milos Columbo is attempting to steal a valuable Fabergé egg, the Lektor device, and a cache of NATO documents.
Outcome: Bond foils Columbo's plan by retrieving the Lektor device and preventing the theft of the Fabergé egg.

Objective: Locque is hired by the villainous General Orlov to steal a Fabergé egg and sell it to a collector, but the real goal is to obtain the stolen ATAC computer system.
Outcome: Locque's plan is foiled by Bond, who retrieves the ATAC computer system and prevents the theft of the Fabergé egg.
Status: Killed by Bond's accomplice, Milos Columbo

Objective: Claus is a smuggler who steals a Fabergé egg, which he plans to sell on the black market.
Outcome: Bond retrieves the Fabergé egg, foiling Claus's plan.

Objective: Retrieve an ATAC missile command system lost by the British in a shipwreck and sell it to the Soviet Union. Additionally, trick Bond and MI6 into killing his main rival, Milos Columbo.
Outcome: Bond joins forces with Melina Havelock and Milos Columbo, infiltrating Kristatos's hideout and throwing the device off a cliff.
Status: Stabbed with a knife thrown by Columbo.

Objective: Trick James Bond and MI6 into stealing a Soviet decoder machine called the Lektor so they can steal it from them, while also destroying Bond's reputation in a humiliating sex scandal and eventually killing him as revenge for the death of Dr. No.
Outcome: Bond acquires the device for MI6 and evades SPECTRE's attempts on his life.
Status: Murdered by SPECTRE on Blofeld's orders after his plan to ruin Bond failed.

Objective: Trick James Bond and MI6 into stealing a Soviet decoder machine called the Lektor so they can steal it from them, while also destroying Bond's reputation in a humiliating sex scandal and eventually killing him as revenge for the death of Dr. No.
Outcome: Bond acquires the device for MI6 and evades SPECTRE's attempts on his life.
Status: Survives (no contact between him and Bond).

Objective: Trick James Bond and MI6 into stealing a Soviet decoder machine called the Lektor so they can steal it from them, while also destroying Bond's reputation in a humiliating sex scandal and eventually killing him as revenge for the death of Dr. No.
Outcome: Bond acquires the device for MI6 and evades SPECTRE's attempts on his life.
Status: Shot in the chest by Tatiana Romanova during an attempt to murder Bond after her last plan failed.

Objective: Morzeny is tasked with eliminating James Bond and obtaining the Lektor machine cipher, a highly advanced encryption device.
Outcome: Morzeny's plan is foiled when Bond and his allies escape, and he is left to fend off the Turkish henchmen.

Objective: Trick James Bond and MI6 into stealing a Soviet decoder machine called the Lektor so they can steal it from them, while also destroying Bond's reputation in a humiliating sex scandal and eventually killing him as revenge for the death of Dr. No.
Outcome: Bond acquires the device for MI6 and evades SPECTRE's attempts on his life.
Status: Killed by Bond in fight aboard the Orient Express.

Objective: General Ourumov is working with Alec Trevelyan to steal the GoldenEye satellite and use its electromagnetic pulse to cripple the Russian military and then the West, allowing for a new world order.
Outcome: Bond and Natalya Simonova foil the plan by destroying the GoldenEye satellite before it can be activated.

Objective: Boris Grishenko plans to steal a Russian nuclear warhead and sell it to the highest bidder, using the GoldenEye satellite to control the world's financial markets.
Outcome: Bond foils Grishenko's plan by destroying the GoldenEye satellite and preventing the sale of the warhead.

Objective: Use an EMP weapon called GoldenEye to destroy London's economy in revenge for British repatriation of Lienz Cossacks which led to the murder-suicide of his parents. Also aims to eliminate Severnaya survivor Natalya Simonova, before she becomes too much trouble.
Outcome: Simonova reprograms the GoldenEye satellite's controls to initiate atmospheric re-entry, thus destroying itself. Bond sabotages the dish's antenna by jamming its gears, rendering Boris Grishenko incapable of undoing Simomova's work.
Status: Bond drops Alec to the bottom of the dish surface, and subsequently ends crushed by the antenna's collapsing beam steering mechanism.

Objective: Irradiate the gold in Fort Knox with a nuclear weapon to increase the value of his own gold.
Outcome: An American technician safely disables the bomb.
Status: Sucked out of the shattered window of a depressurizing plane, falling to his death.

Objective: Oddjob plans to break into Fort Knox and steal all the gold reserves, using his unique hat to deflect bullets and security measures.
Outcome: Oddjob's plan is foiled by Bond, who discovers the location of the Fort Knox heist and kills Oddjob in the process.

Objective: Mr. Ling, the henchman of Auric Goldfinger, is tasked with capturing James Bond and preventing him from interfering with Goldfinger's plan to rob Fort Knox.
Outcome: Bond manages to escape and foil Goldfinger's plan, with Mr. Ling being defeated and captured.

Objective: To oversee the operation of Auric Goldfinger's plan to rob Fort Knox, ensuring the successful execution of the heist.
Outcome: Bond foils the plan by discovering the true target of the operation, which is not Fort Knox but the United States gold reserve at Fort Knox, and Goldfinger's plan is ultimately thwarted.

Objective: Assisting Auric Goldfinger in his operation to rob Fort Knox.
Outcome: Foiled by Bond, Simmons is killed in the process.

Objective: Milton Krest is seeking revenge against Bond for killing his friend and business partner, Franz Sanchez, and plans to kill him by putting him in a shark tank.
Outcome: Bond manages to escape the shark tank, and Milton Krest is subsequently killed by Franz Sanchez's henchmen.

Objective: Ed Killifer is working with Franz Sanchez to smuggle cocaine and kill anyone who gets in their way.
Outcome: Ed Killifer's smuggling operation is disrupted by Bond, and he is eventually killed.

Objective: Colonel Heller is working with Franz Sanchez to smuggle cocaine and is responsible for the torture and death of Felix Leiter's wife, which sets off a chain of events leading to Bond's revenge.
Outcome: Bond foils Heller's plan by tracking down Sanchez and ultimately killing him in a confrontation.

Objective: Hector Lopez is involved in a cocaine smuggling operation and is responsible for the death of Felix Leiter's wife, which sets off a chain of events that leads to Bond's pursuit of him.
Outcome: Bond foils Lopez's operation and kills him in a confrontation.

Objective: Sharkey is a henchman working for Franz Sanchez, tasked with intimidating Felix Leiter and his new wife, Della, into revealing information about Sanchez's operation.
Outcome: Sharkey's intimidation attempt fails, and he is ultimately killed by Bond in a fight.

Objective: Braun is involved in a cocaine trafficking operation and is responsible for the death of Felix Leiter's wife, which sets Bond on his mission.
Outcome: Bond discovers Braun's operation and foils it, but Braun is killed by a shark.

Objective: Kwang is a member of the crime syndicate led by Franz Sanchez, and his objective is to help Sanchez escape from the authorities.
Outcome: Bond foils Kwang's plan by helping Sanchez's associates take revenge on him, and he is subsequently killed.

Objective: Hawkins is working with Franz Sanchez to smuggle cocaine and is responsible for the torture and death of Felix Leiter's wife, which sets off Felix's vendetta against Sanchez.
Outcome: Bond foils Hawkins' smuggling operation, but not directly, as it is Sanchez who is ultimately defeated by Bond.

Objective: Montelongo's objective is to smuggle cocaine and use the profits to fund his own operations.
Outcome: Bond foils Montelongo's plan by stopping the smuggling operation and killing him.

Objective: Alvarez is working with Franz Sanchez to smuggle cocaine and exact revenge on those who wronged him.
Outcome: Bond foils Alvarez's plan by killing him and dismantling Sanchez's operation.

Objective: Dario's objective is to exact revenge on Felix Leiter for the death of his girlfriend, Della, and to disrupt the cocaine trade in the Caribbean.
Outcome: Dario's plan is foiled by Bond, who helps Felix Leiter and ultimately kills Dario.

Objective: Smuggle a large shipment of cocaine into Asia by dissolving the substance in petrol.
Outcome: Bond destroys the refinery used to dissolve the cocaine and later the four tankers that are already filled.
Status: Bond sets Sanchez, who is soaked in gasoline due to a tanker crash, on fire with a lighter gifted by Felix Leiter. Burning Sanchez stumbles into a leaking tank truck, causing the leaked gasoline to catch on fire and make the tanker explode, killing Sanchez.

Objective: Baron Samedi seeks to avenge his master, Mr. Big, by killing James Bond and disrupting the heroin trade in the Caribbean.
Outcome: Bond foils Baron Samedi's plans with the help of Solitaire, and Baron Samedi is killed in a fire.

Objective: Distribute a large cache of heroin into the United States without cost, driving his competitors out of business and gaining a monopoly.
Outcome: Quarrel Jr. destroys Kananga's poppy fields with a series of explosives.
Status: Forced by Bond to ingest a compressed gas pellet, causing him to inflate and explode.

Objective: Whisper is a henchman of Mr. Big, working to smuggle heroin and diamonds.
Outcome: Whisper's smuggling operation is disrupted by Bond, but he is not directly involved in foiling the plan.

Objective: Adam is a henchman working for Mr. Big, tasked with retrieving a stolen shipment of heroin and silencing those involved.
Outcome: Adam's plan is foiled when he is killed by Bond, who is able to escape the situation.

Objective: Tee Hee is a henchman working for Mr. Big, helping him to smuggle heroin and diamonds, and later assisting in the plot to kill Solitaire.
Outcome: Tee Hee's plans are foiled by Bond, who kills him in a fight.

Objective: Chang is a henchman working for Hugo Drax, and his objective is to assist Drax in his plan to wipe out humanity and rebuild society with a new, superior breed.
Outcome: Chang's plan is foiled by Bond, who stops Drax's space station from colliding with the Earth.

Objective: Jaws, a giant of a man with metal teeth, is working for Hugo Drax to kill astronauts and passengers on the Moonraker space shuttle, which Drax plans to use to wipe out humanity and start anew.
Outcome: Bond and Goodhead foil Jaws' plans by using a giant harpoon to kill him in the space shuttle's cargo bay.

Objective: Fire a nerve agent from space, poisoning Earth's atmosphere and killing off the human population. Rebuild humanity in space with carefully selected humans.
Outcome: The space station containing the poisonous globes is destroyed by US Marines, and the three globes that were launched are destroyed by Bond and Holly Goodhead.
Status: Shot with a dart by Bond and ejected into outer space.

Objective: Primo is a henchman working for Safin, tasked with capturing and interrogating Bond, and later assisting in the operation to destroy the world's population by unleashing a deadly virus.
Outcome: Although Primo is successful in capturing Bond, his plan ultimately fails as Bond is able to escape and prevent the virus from being released.

Objective: Escape prison, restore SPECTRE, and eliminate Bond using Heracles.
Outcome: Safin uses Heracles to wipe out SPECTRE in Cuba and later coerces Madeleine Swann into killing Blofeld with it.
Status: Inadvertently infected with Heracles when Bond briefly touches and strangles him—after he touched Swann—during an interrogation and dies as a result.

Objective: Wipe out SPECTRE after Blofeld ordered Mr. White to assassinate his family. Later take revenge on the world at large by using "Heracles" – a DNA-based bioweapon which SPECTRE stole from MI6.
Outcome: Succeeds in wiping out SPECTRE but fails to spread Heracles worldwide due to the Royal Navy's and Bond's intervention, which destroys the facility producing it.
Status: Shot by Bond after a brief fistfight.

Objective: Gobinda is working for Kamal Khan to steal a Fabergé egg and use it to detonate a nuclear bomb, forcing the British government to withdraw from Afghanistan.
Outcome: Bond foils the plan by stopping the theft of the Fabergé egg and preventing the nuclear explosion.

Objective: To smuggle a nuclear bomb into the United States and sell it to the highest bidder, with the goal of creating chaos and destruction.
Outcome: Bond foiled the plan by stopping the sale of the bomb and preventing it from being smuggled into the US.

Objective: Smithers is working with General Orlov to steal a valuable Fabergé egg and use its gemstones to fund a Soviet-backed rebellion in Afghanistan.
Outcome: Bond foils the plan by preventing the theft of the Fabergé egg and exposing General Orlov's scheme.

Objective: Execute General Orlov's plan in exchange for being paid in jewels stolen from the Kremlin.
Outcome: The jewels are recovered by the KGB.
Status: Attempts to escape in his plane, but Bond disables the left engine of the plane, causing Khan to crash it into a mountain, killing him.

Objective: Smuggle a nuclear warhead onto a US Air Force Base in West Germany and detonate it to clear a path for the Soviet Bloc to conquer Western Europe.
Outcome: Bond, with the help of Octopussy, disarms the bomb.
Status: Shot by guards who believe that he is trying to defect.

Objective: Irma Bunt is working for Ernst Stavro Blofeld, helping him to abduct and brainwash women to create the perfect female accomplice.
Outcome: Bond foils her plan by rescuing the women and stopping Blofeld's operation.

Objective: Distribute an infertility-based viral plague to destroy livestock and cereals, unless issued a pardon by the United Nations and the title of count by the College of Arms.
Outcome: Bond and Marc-Ange Draco destroy the laboratory and radio station from which commands to distribute the viruses are issued. Agents supposedly neutralised.
Status: Survives, despite neck injury. His henchwoman Irma Bunt assassinates Tracy di Vicenzo, Bond's newly married wife, on their honeymoon.

Objective: Escape MI6 custody.
Outcome: Succeeds.
Status: Survives (returns in Spectre where he is dying from thallium poisoning and commits suicide using Bond's Walther PPK).

Objective: Carry out a coup d'état in Bolivia and install his puppet ruler, General Medrano, in exchange for land hiding a massively valuable, undiscovered aquifer. Then sell the new Bolivian government water from the aquifer at massively inflated prices.
Outcome: Bond intercepts Greene and Medrano before they can carry out the coup.
Status: Bond abandons him in the middle of the Bolivian desert, with nothing but a can of motor oil to drink. He is later reported to have been shot by an anonymous assassin after drinking the oil.

Objective: Part of Silva's plan to destroy MI6's headquarters and exact revenge on M.
Outcome: His role in the plan is foiled when Bond and Q destroy the hard drive containing the MI6 personnel list.

Objective: Clair Dowar's objective is to identify and eliminate the double agent within MI6, which she believes is a mole within the organization.
Outcome: Her plan is foiled when Bond and M uncover the true identity of the double agent, who is actually Raoul Silva, and she is unable to stop them.

Objective: Take revenge on M by launching a massive cyberattack on MI6 and then personally carry out her assassination.
Outcome: Indirectly succeeds. Bond foils his first assassination attempt, but later she is fatally wounded by one of his henchmen. (Although, he does not live to realize this or find the closure he sought.)
Status: Bond throws a hunting knife into his back.

Objective: Gain control of a global surveillance program called "Nine Eyes".
Outcome: Bond destroys Blofeld's data center and Q prevents the Nine Eyes program from being activated.
Status: Arrested by M after he survives his escape helicopter being shot down by Bond.

Objective: Mr. Hinx is a henchman working for the villainous organization SPECTRE, tasked with capturing Madeleine Swann, a woman with a connection to Bond's past.
Outcome: Hinx's plan is foiled when Bond kills him in a car chase, saving Madeleine.

Objective: Mr. White is trying to protect the truth about SPECTRE's existence and its connection to Bond's past.
Outcome: Although he fails to stop Bond from uncovering SPECTRE's plans, he manages to escape and remains at large.

Objective: To take revenge on the world for the death of his father, a former SPECTRE member, and to kill Bond.
Outcome: Bond kills him in a shootout at the Vatican.

Objective: Gain control of a global surveillance program called "Nine Eyes".
Outcome: Bond destroys Blofeld's data center and Q prevents the Nine Eyes program from being activated.
Status: Engages in a fight with M and falls to his death.

Objective: Fake a defection and trick MI6 into killing his rival, General Leonid Pushkin, to cover-up his weapon smuggling racket, which Pushkin was investigating.
Outcome: Bond and Pushkin fake the latter's assassination and Bond destroys the shipment of opium that Koskov was going to use to buy weapons from Whitaker.
Status: Arrested by Pushkin; implied to be executed by the Soviet government, off-screen.

Objective: Necros' objective is to steal a Fabergé egg, which is a valuable and highly sought-after item, and sell it to a wealthy collector.
Outcome: Bond foils Necros' plan by preventing him from selling the egg, and Necros is ultimately killed by Bond.

Objective: Kamran Shah's objective is to sell a large shipment of Semtex to the mujahideen in Afghanistan, which would then be used to destabilize the Soviet Union.
Outcome: Bond foils Shah's plan by intercepting the Semtex shipment, and Shah is subsequently killed by a Soviet sniper.

Objective: Engage in a triangle deal with Koskov and the Mujahadeen, where Whitaker will get valuable opium in exchange for high-tech weapons.
Outcome: Bond destroys the shipment of opium, ruining the deal.
Status: Bond activates a bomb disguised as a key chain, dropping a bust of the Duke of Wellington on Whitaker, crushing him.

Film: The Man with the Golden Gun
Objective: Chula is tasked with killing Bond, who has been identified as a threat to Scaramanga's reputation and business.
Outcome: Chula fails to kill Bond and is ultimately killed by Scaramanga's henchmen for his failure.

Film: The Man with the Golden Gun
Objective: Nick Nack assists Scaramanga in killing Bond and obtaining the Golden Gun, a powerful laser pistol.
Outcome: Nick Nack's plan is foiled when Bond escapes and ultimately kills Scaramanga, rendering Nick Nack's assistance unnecessary.
Status: Survives, but is left to fend for himself after Scaramanga's death.

Film: The Man with the Golden Gun
Objective: Kill James Bond and sell the Solex Agitator, a device that can harness solar energy for destructive purposes.
Outcome: Bond retrieves the Agitator for MI6 and defeats Scaramanga in mortal combat.
Status: Shot in the chest by Bond during their duel.

Objective: Capture a British submarine and a Soviet submarine and use them to trick Britain and the USSR into starting a nuclear war. Once the world's population has been decimated, repopulate the Earth with a new society under his control formed in secret bases under the ocean.
Outcome: Bond redirects the British and Soviet nuclear missiles' coordinates so that the missile fired by each sub hits the other, destroying them.
Status: Shot repeatedly by Bond using his own dinner table booby trap.

Objective: General Gogol's objective is to acquire a nuclear submarine, the Red October, to further Soviet interests.
Outcome: Bond foils Gogol's plan by stopping the Red October, but Gogol survives.

Objective: Sandor is a henchman working for Karl Stromberg, tasked with capturing a Soviet submarine, the Red October, to further Stromberg's plan for world domination.
Outcome: Bond foils Sandor's plan by preventing the capture of the Red October, and Sandor is subsequently defeated.

Objective: Jaws is a henchman working for Karl Stromberg, tasked with sinking the British and American submarines to start a war.
Outcome: Jaws' plan is foiled when Bond and Anya Amasova work together to stop him, and he is ultimately killed by a giant metal claw.
Status: Killed by a giant metal claw

Objective: Gain a monopoly on crude oil in Europe by setting off a nuclear explosion in Istanbul, rendering the Bosporus Strait impassable to tankers carrying oil from competing pipelines. Also murder M in retaliation for ordering her father Sir Robert King to not pay the ransom after her kidnapping.
Outcome: Bond kills her and then stops the detonation of the submarine.
Status: Shot in the chest by Bond after she refused to order Renard to surrender.

Objective: Charles Robinson, a former MI6 agent, seeks revenge against Elektra King, the daughter of a wealthy oil tycoon, for his own betrayal and subsequent imprisonment.
Outcome: Bond foils Robinson's plan by stopping his attempt to kill Elektra, and Robinson is killed by Elektra's henchmen.

Objective: Detonate a nuclear submarine in the waters of Istanbul to serve Elektra's plan.
Outcome: Bond kills him before he can overload the submarine's reactor.
Status: Impaled by a plutonium rod, shot out of the sub's reactor core at high speed, by Bond.

Objective: Steal two atomic bombs and use them to extort money from various world governments.
Outcome: The bombs are recovered and safely destroyed by Bond and the U.S. Coast Guard.
Status: Survives (no contact between him and Bond).

Objective: Steal two atomic bombs and use them to extort money from various world governments.
Outcome: The bombs are recovered and safely destroyed by Bond and the U.S. Coast Guard.
Status: Shot in the back with a harpoon by his mistress, Domino Derval.

Objective: Quist's objective is not explicitly stated in the film, but he is part of SPECTRE's operation to steal nuclear warheads.
Outcome: Quist's plan is foiled by Bond, but the details of his involvement are unclear.
Status: No clear fate is stated for Quist in the film.

Objective: Jeff Hobbs' objective is to start a war between the UK and China by manipulating the media and the British government.
Outcome: Hobbs' plan is foiled by Bond, who exposes the truth and stops the war from occurring.

Objective: Charles Robinson, a media mogul, aims to start a war between the UK and China by manipulating the media and creating a false crisis.
Outcome: Bond and his allies are able to expose Robinson's plan and prevent the war, but not before he is killed in a helicopter crash.

Objective: Cause a war between the UK and China by firing a cruise missile from a sunken British warship towards Beijing, both so he can arrange a broadcasting deal with a new Chinese government and so that his media empire will have more news to cover.
Outcome: Bond destroys Carver's stealth boat in a massive explosion, destroying the missile before it can launch.
Status: Bond incapacitates Carver and leaves him in the path of his own Sea-Vac drill, which shreds him to pieces.

Objective: Stamper's objective is to sell classified information about the British Navy to the highest bidder, using a satellite system.
Outcome: Bond foils Stamper's plan by destroying the satellite and stopping the sale of classified information.

Objective: Hans is a Japanese agent working for the villainous organization SPECTRE, tasked with stealing American and Soviet space rockets to create a massive space-based nuclear missile.
Outcome: Bond foils Hans' plan by discovering and stopping the theft of the space rockets, and Hans is subsequently killed by the Japanese authorities.

Objective: Trigger a war between the United States and Soviet Union, on the behalf of China, by capturing their space capsules midflight.
Outcome: Bond uses a self-destruct button in Blofeld's lair to destroy the Bird One spacecraft.

Objective: Helga Brandt seeks revenge against James Bond and the British government for the death of her lover, Ernst Stavro Blofeld's, henchman, and attempts to lure Bond into a trap.
Outcome: Bond discovers her plan and ultimately kills her in a fight.

Objective: Ling is a Japanese double agent working for SPECTRE, her objective is to lure Bond to Japan and have him killed, thereby preventing him from interfering with SPECTRE's plans.
Outcome: Bond discovers Ling's true intentions and foils her plan, ultimately leading to her death.
